name: EA-015-Foucault
description:
Michel Foucault (1926 – 1984 aC) was a philosopher, historian of ideas, social theorist, philologist, literary critic and professor of the History of Systems of Thought professorship at the famous Collège de France from 1970 to 1984. Foucault is known for his criticisms of social institutions, especially psychiatry, medicine, prisons, and for his ideas about the evolution of the history of sexuality, his general theories concerning power and the complex relationship between power and knowledge, as well as for study the expression of discourse in relation to the history of western thought. The image of the "death of man", announced in As Palavras e Homens, and the idea of ​​subjectivation, reactivated in self-interest in a way that is still problematic for the classic philosophy of the subject, have been widely discussed. It seems, then, that more than in "identity" analyzes, which are, by definition, static and objectified, Foucault focuses on life and on the different processes of subjectivation

Digital Watercolor Vector Illustration made in Adobe Photoshop, 1200x1200px, 200dpi, JPEG, 2021
